intent: Added cargo fmt and clippy checks to CI pipeline
reasoning_trace:
Added formatting and linting checks to catch code quality issues early in the CI pipeline.

The changes add two new steps before the build:
1. cargo fmt --all -- --check - Verifies code formatting matches rustfmt standards
2. cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings - Runs the Rust linter with all targets/features and treats warnings as errors

These run BEFORE build/test to fail fast on style issues without wasting CI time on builds that will need reformatting anyway.

Trade-offs:
- Pro: Catches formatting and lint issues before merge, enforces consistent code style
- Pro: -D warnings ensures no lints slip through
- Con: Slightly longer CI time (though clippy is fast)

The --all-targets flag ensures clippy checks tests and examples too, not just library code.
The --all-features flag ensures feature-gated code is also checked.

rejected_alternatives.name: Running clippy without -D warnings (would allow warnings to accumulate)
Running fmt/clippy after build (wastes CI time if style issues exist)
Using a separate lint job (adds complexity, parallel execution not needed for fast checks)
